byline.contributor: Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Yang Jisheng, author of landmark book Tombstone, says his former employer Xinhua News Agency has forbidden him to travel to Harvard University to receive Louis M Lyons Award for Conscience and Integrity in Journalism; book, banned in China, reveals how deaths of millions during 1958-62 famine were result of government policies under Mao.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Writer of Book About Famine Is Barred From Going to U.S. for Award
headline.main: Chinese Writer Says He’s Forbidden From Traveling to U.S. for Harvard Prize

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Yang Jisheng said that officials from his former employer, the Xinhua News Agency, had forbidden him from traveling to Harvard.
lead_paragraph: Yang Jisheng said that officials from his former employer, the Xinhua News Agency, had forbidden him from traveling to Harvard.
